I don't know. The current implementation requires a lot of special casing and careful graph introspection to properly identify which tensors should stay in the stack for gradient purposes, and for e.g. handling of external and within body stop gradient calls. There is also a lot of special handling in the runtime. Compound that with nested while loop handling and possibly needing to modify TensorArray to support second+ derivatives... At the very least, first we should move while loop and gradients to the c++ api, and decide whether we want full Jacobian support, then we can consider this.

body:
I don't know.  The current implementation requires a lot of special casing
and careful graph introspection to properly identify which tensors should
stay in the stack for gradient purposes, and for e.g. handling of external
and within body stop gradient calls.  There is also a lot of special
handling in the runtime.  Compound that with nested while loop handling and
possibly needing to modify TensorArray to support second+ derivatives...

At the very least, first we should move while loop and gradients to the c++
api, and decide whether we want full Jacobian support, then we can consider
this.
